channel.title: Boards on Omega Psi at JHU
channel.description: Recent content in Boards on Omega Psi at JHU

item.title: Anne Li
item.description: Anne is a junior at the Johns Hopkins University double majoring in neuroscience and Spanish on a pre-medical track. Her research interests include using microRNAs as a potential source of therapy for diseases, especially neurological diseases and brain cancers. She is currently working with microRNAs and glioblastoma. Her aim is to achieve an MD-PhD and work in pediatric neurology.

item.title: Arunima Vijay
item.description: Arunima is a senior majoring in Cognitive Science with focal areas in linguistics and neuroscience. She researches the development of perceptual and mental verbs in children, and is also interested in the using art as a therapeutic method for developmental disorders. Following college, she plans on attending medical school to pursue her aspiration of becoming a physician-researcher concentrated on global care and linguistic development of Autistic populations.

item.title: Angela Wang
item.description: Angela Wang is a junior majoring in public health and psychology. Her research interests are clinical and cognitive psychology. She loves to watch Netflix and korean dramas in her free time and is excited to contribute more to Omega Psi this semester.

item.title: Coleman Haley
item.description: Arunima is a senior majoring in Cognitive Science with focal areas in linguistics and neuroscience.
